title:
Cordless Handheld Standard Range Area Imager Kit with Presentation Cradle and USB Kit, Black,
Compatible Devices: Laptop, Desktop, Power Source: Corded Electric, Usb Cable, 3 AAA batteries required.
descriptions:
Meet the ZEBRA Cordless Handheld Scanner Kit — a simple, reliable barcode scanner that’s easy to use and gentle on the hands.

What it does:
- Quickly reads barcodes you point it at, from labels, receipts, and packages.
- Works with both old and new barcodes (1D and 2D), so you don’t have to worry which kind you have.
- Scans from any angle. You don’t need to line things up perfectly.

Why it’s easy:
- Lightweight and comfortable to hold. Good for small or weak hands.
- Comes pre‑set from the factory. Take it out of the box and start using it.
- A helpful aim line shows you where you’re scanning.
- The included stand (presentation cradle) lets you set it down and scan hands‑free.

How it connects:
- Plug it into a laptop or desktop with the USB cable.
- Or use it cordless with 3 AAA batteries. You can choose what’s easiest.
- Auto‑host cables help it set itself up when you plug it in.

Where it fits:
- Great for home use, small shops, church offices, community centers, and front desks.
- Built for everyday needs in retail and hospitality, but simple enough for anyone.

What’s in the box:
- Handheld scanner (black)
- Presentation cradle (stand)
- USB cable
- Quick start setup

Plain‑language setup:
1) If you want simple plug‑in use: connect the USB cable to your computer and the scanner. It should work right away.  
2) If you want cordless: insert 3 AAA batteries, place the scanner in the cradle to pair, then start scanning.

Friendly reminders:
- The scanner beeps or shows a light when it reads a barcode—no need to press hard or hold very still.
- You can hold it close to the barcode for best results.
- If you’re not sure what to do, just plug in the USB cable and try a test scan.

ZEBRA makes sturdy, dependable equipment. This scanner is designed to reduce hand strain, avoid fuss, and simply get the job done.
